definition: Suzhou Creek (river in Shanghai)
old variant of 蘇|苏[su1]
surname Su/abbr. for Soviet Union 蘇維埃|苏维埃 or 蘇聯|苏联/abbr. for Jiangsu province 江蘇|江苏/abbr. for Suzhou city 蘇州|苏州
see 囉囌|啰苏[luo1 su1]
variant of 蘇|苏[su1]/to revive
Perilla frutescens (Chinese basil or wild red basil)/place name/to revive/used as phonetic in transliteration
prefecture/(old) province/(old) administrative division/state (e.g. of US)/oblast (Russia)/canton (Switzerland)
river/CL:條|条[tiao2],道[dao4]

sentences.english: Suchow creek. Traffic jam. During the last days of the Kuomintang.
sentences.chinese: 国民党政府执政的最后几天中，苏州河航道拥堵。

sentences.english: Since its birth, Shanghai has closely been tied with the Suzhou Creek.
sentences.chinese: 上海自出生之日起，就与苏州河息息相连。

sentences.english: To the north of the Hotel is Suzhou River and to the east is the famous yacht pier pf Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 北面俯瞰苏州河，东边是上海滩著名的游艇码头。

sentences.english: The municipal government has decided to conduct a comprehensive treatment to the environmental problems along the Suzhou River.
sentences.chinese: 市政府决定对苏州河沿岸的环境问题进行综合治理。

sentences.english: For instance, do you still remember the limpid in Suzhou Creek?
sentences.chinese: 例如，你还记得在苏州河清澈？

definition: Huangpu River in Shanghai
the Shanghai Bund or Waitan
the Yongjiang river through Ningbo 寧波|宁波[Ning2 bo1]
Qiantang River that loops around Hangzhou 杭州[Hang2 zhou1] in Zhejiang Province 浙江省[Zhe4 jiang1 Sheng3]
Chongming Island
the Shanghai of old, with its foreign settlements/(fig.) a bustling, cosmopolitan city
Nanjing St., large commercial street in Shanghai
Dianshan Lake between Shanghai Municipality and Jiangsu Province
"shikumen" style architecture: traditional (ca. 19th century) residences with courtyards, once common in Shanghai
Hai He (a system of five waterways around Tianjin, flowing into Bohai 渤海 at Dagukou 大沽口)
Seine
Wusong river and dock area in Shanghai
People's Square, Shanghai
Shanghai-Nanjing Railway, a.k.a. Huning Railway
the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC
(dialect) alley/lane
